Welcome to Tutorials Quest!

As you know, one of the great resources on the PerlMonks site is the library of user-contributed wisdom known as Tutorials.

The [Tutorials] section is hierarchically organized by topic, for your browsing convenience. For more power, you can [href://?node_id=3989;re=N;Tu|Super Search Tutorials] to find articles of interest.

Now, as much great stuff as already exists in [Tutorials], there are still significant gaps in the coverage — not all of them identified (yet). Where needs have been identified, they are listed here.

If you are looking for a way to contribute to Perl's knowledgebase in an area of your special expertise, please consider submitting a Tutorial! Please note the recommended procedure is to post a new Tutorial first as [Meditations|Meditation], with "RFC" in the title.

The instructions on how to write a Tutorial can be found on the [Tutorials] page itself.

If you do think you want to write a tutorial in satisfaction of one of the posted requests, please let [Pedagogues] know, because if multiple people express an interest in a topic, we can hook you up for possible collaboration.

If you have a suggestion for a tutorial to be written, please [msg://pedagogues] with your idea.

This page and the [Tutorials] section are managed by the [id://591017|Pedagogues] group. If you have any questions about this page or the [Tutorials] section, [msg://pedagogues], or find one of the [Pedagogues] in the [id://236794|Chatterbox] and ask them publicly.

Tutorials on the following subjects are needed:

HTML Cleanup and Demoronisation

A tutorial on the available and preferred techniques and modules for sanitizing ([http://www.fourmilab.ch/webtools/demoroniser/|demoronising]) HTML generated by Microsoft apps, and on HTML [http://tidy.sourceforge.net/|tidying] generally.
See [ww]'s post, [id://524507].

Suggested by [ww] on [localtime://2006-01-24 20:34]

Mechanize

Tutorial on the basics and the intricacies of [mod://WWW::Mechanize].

Suggested by [planetscape] on [localtime://2006-01-26 11:22:09]

Perl 6

For example: Getting started, the new regexes system, the new object system, Parrot, and Pugs.

Suggested by [citromatik] on [localtime://2007-06-28 9:55:04]

Dynamic Programming

A tutorial about dynamic programming in Perl, with a real world example (such as the knapsack problem; see [mod://Algorithm::Knap01DP]).

Suggested by [Limbic~Region] on [localtime://2008-01-30]

Context

Tutorials on context (i.e. scalar context, list context) are needed. We have one, a fairly narrowly focused meditation on [id://347416|the scalar-context return values of things normally called in list context]. Much more is needed.

Update: We now have one [id://738558]. Thanks, [kyle]!

Debugging, Benchmarking, and Profiling

We have one tutorial — [id://8745] — but it doesn't cover a lot of the subtleties and pitfalls of benchmarking. It also only talks about [mod://Benchmark].pm, and doesn't cover profiling at all.
We also need some more in-depth articles on debugging Perl programs.

Suggested by [blazar] on [localtime://2007-07-12]
and by [jakobi] in [id://798375]

Update: We now have one on [id://633699|profiling]. Thanks, [Kyle]!
